chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st w/Pass.)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary T Reindl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zachary T Reindl is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zachary T Reindl was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st w/Pass.), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at $50 per month commencing 11-01-2014 and each month thereafter or serve 23 days huber, consecutive for non payment of fine.

As of 12-6-2016:   Pursuant to Supreme Court decision in State v Elward, 2015 WI App 51, 363, DNA surcharge is vacated and modified to zero.   Refund check was issued to deft./poster.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs ($35) to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Muskego Police Department.  To be paid consecutive to fine or be converted to a civil judgment for non payment.  DNA surcharge $200) to be paid consecutive to fine or serve 4 days huber, consecutive as penalty for non payment of costs.

Huber with standard release conditions.
Defendant to report to Huber facility by 06:00 p.m. on 08-15-2014.
Apply 2 days credit.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on 11-29-2014.  Defendant to serve 20 days huber, consecutive as penalty for non attendance at Victim Impact Panel.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: re: DNA surcharge modification letter signed by Judge Ralph M. Ramirez.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Margaret Drees appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Zachary T Reindl in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 3.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 3.
Count 1 is Dismissed and Read-In.
Count 2 is Dismissed by Operation of Law.
  
Court Orders the  Following:
Count 3:
20 Days in the Waukesha County Jail W/HUBER (All Standard Release Conditions)
 2  Days Credit
Defendant to report to Huber facility by 6:00 p.m. on:  08/15/14

FINE: $ 1,129.00                       
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00  
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Muskego Police Department or to be converted to a civil judgment for non payment of fee.
IGNITION INTERLOCK SURCHARGE:  $50.00  
Court will allow for a payment plan - $50 per month, starting 11/1/2014 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate for non-payment is 29 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions), consecutive to any other sentence.

14 Months - D/L REVOCATION  - Concurrent
14 Months - IGNITION INTERLOCK 

Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on:  11/19/14
Alternate for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel is 20 days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions), consecutive to any other sentence, as penalty .
  
Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

records.addlTxt: Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 6, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Zachary T Reindl in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Bryan C Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant to begin treatment next week.  
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Zachary T Reindl in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Eryn Menden for Attorney Joseph Smith in court.   Defendant Zachary T Reindl did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Menden does not know why defendant is not here for court. State has no objection to a stayed capias. Court orders, but stays capias until next court date. Defendant, Zachary Reindl, arrived late at 10:10 a.m. Court rescinded capias order.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.    Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring this afternoon.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program including random urine screens. Defendant to have no contact with the child S.A.H.

Defendant Zachary T Reindl in court.  Erik Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Preliminary  Hearing time limits tolled.  Hearing scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
